Invest in friendships only if you plan to have them for the next 50 years.  

Use your job to build skill-sets you’re going to use for the next 50 years.

Pick up hobbies only if you’ll pursue them for the next 50 years.

Everything great compounds.

1126156251065462784.text: Continually amazed by the momentum behind the #DeFi movement. @MakerDAO has been the tip of the spear pushing forward. ~$300M in loans issued to date and ~$235M since last May (~380% growth YoY). That's a real and measurable impact. What will the stats be in 2020?pic.twitter.com/KIN6TfGhF3

1124063043867095063.text: 2/ Since the rate hikes, open debt has gotten younger and more old debt has been closed out. What's different? Higher stability fees. One apparent positive outcome of these increases is improved debt circulation.

1124063042025738240.text: 1/ Circulation of debt is IMO an important health metric for the @MakerDAO system. Before the stability fee hikes, the avg. age of $DAI was consistently increasing (dips at ETH price drops due to liquidations). Blue = age of open debt, red = age of liquidated and paid-back debt.pic.twitter.com/BBxNfZPRUS

1120870345047670785.text: And total ETH traded to-date = ~380K (350K from just the top 5).

1120869911717470209.text:
ETH volume to-date of the 5 most traded assets on @UniswapExchange from http://uniswap.rocks :
1. @MakerDAO MKR ~170K ETH
2. Dai ~148K ETH
3. TrueUSD ~13K ETH
4. BAT ~10K ETH
5. @AugurProject REP ~5.7K ETH
@SpankChain at a close #6 w. ~5.5K.

Amazing progress.

1120461916063793153.text:
With @MakerDAO stability fee now at 14.5%, it's cheaper to borrow Dai from @compoundfinance. Outstanding Dai supply has come down 6% in the last 10 days. ~1.3M Dai wiped on the day of the most recent rate hike (4/19). 

https://vic007207.github.io/crypto_data/ pic.twitter.com/WHWDMWBSbp

1119995482653319168.text: Some simple Sunday algebra (backed by data), the percentage collateral seized from a @MakerDAO CDP in liquidation is ~75-77% of the PETH locked in the CDP (~67% * 113%).

1116500721950654465.text: 2/ This seems to be due, in large part to a single address borrowing 1.25M Dai on @compoundfinance to pay back debt on @MakerDAO. Guess borrowing was cheaper/easier than buying. This same address appears to have also borrowed 100k REP (~$1.8M) for use on @AugurProject.

1116500720541425665.text:
1/ In the past 24 hours, the Dai loan borrow volume jumped by a whopping 44% on @compoundfinance, bringing the borrow APR up to 14.5% from 10.9% and the supply APR up to 7.34% (just shy of the 7.5% @MakerDAO stability fee). 

Source: https://vic007207.github.io/crypto_data/ pic.twitter.com/vCF48kst5J

1116022359151001600.text: There has been an 8.5% increase in Dai supply over last 7 days (Dai burned dropped below Dai drawn). It's back up to ~93M (higher than at the time of the recent stability fee increase). Clearly 7.5% is not enough to deter the avid borrowers. Suspect this is about leverage on ETH.pic.twitter.com/NIcpmEqElV

1114889379594547201.text:
If someone "gives" someone else a CDP with 100 Dai in debt, should we actually consider that some % of 100 Dai was transacted? ...food for thought. Looks like ~96M Dai given in this way to date. @MakerDAO 

Source: https://vic007207.github.io/crypto_data/ pic.twitter.com/oa2h8OcGIl

1105584836780195840.text: The gap has been closing over time and @MakerDAO 3.5% stability fee has overtaken @compoundfinance loan supply rate. 1072952297506963461.text: 25. Are there any best practices for conducting an independent audit of ETH deposits?

1072952296370262017.text: 24. Are there any best practices for the construction and security of ETH wallets, including, but not limited to, the number of keys required to sign a transaction and how access to the keys should be segregated?

1072952295757877248.text: 23. Are there security issues peculiar to the Ethereum Network or Ethereum- supported smart contracts that need to be addressed?

1072952294914826245.text:
21. What other factors could impact the Commission’s ability to properly oversee or monitor trading in derivative contracts on ETH as well as the underlying ETH cash markets?
22. Are there any emerging best practices for monitoring the [E.N.] and public blockchains more broadly?

1072952294252183553.text: 20. Are there any types of trader or intermediary conduct that has occurred in the international Ether derivative markets that raise market risks or challenges and should be monitored closely by trading venues or regulators

1072952293350367232.text: 19. Please list any potential impacts on Ether and the Ethereum Network that may arise from the listing or trading of derivative contracts on Ether.

1072952292721201155.text: 18. Given the evolving nature of the Ether cash markets underlying potential Ether derivative contracts, what are the commercial risk management needs for a derivative contract on Ether?

1072952291886546944.text: 17. How would the introduction of derivative contracts on Ether potentially change or modify the incentive structures that underlie a proof of stake consensus model?

1072952291198685184.text: ...How do these impediments or risks impact [reg.] considerations for Commission registrants w.r.t. participating in any transactions in ETH, including the ability to obtain or demonstrate possession or control or otherwise hold ETH as collateral or on behalf of customers?

1072952290426974208.text:
15. Are there protections or impediments that would prevent market participants or other actors from intentionally disrupting the normal function of the [E.N.] [or the] ETH market?
16. What impediments or risks exist to the reliable conversion of ETH to legal tender?

1072952289802010624.text: 14. In light of Ether’s origins as an outgrowth from the Ethereum Classic blockchain, are there potential issues that could make Ether’s underlying blockchain vulnerable to future hard forks or splintering?

1072952289130938381.text:
12. What capability does the Ethereum Network have to support the continued development and increasing use of smart contracts?
13. How is the governance of the Ethereum Network similar to and different from the governance of the Bitcoin network?

1072952288426278912.text: 11. There are reports of disagreements within the ETH community over the proposed transition to a PoS consensus model. Could this transition from a PoW to a PoS verification process result in a fragmented or diminished ETH market if the disagreements are not resolved?

1072952287641956353.text: 10. Relative to a PoW consensus mechanism does PoS have particular vulnerabilities, challenges, or features that make it prone to manipulation? ...consider that under a PoS consensus mechanism, the chance of validating a block may be proportional to staked wealth.

1072952286916345866.text: 9. Has a proof of stake consensus mechanism been tested or validated at scale? If so, what lessons or insights can be learned from the experience?

1072952286048067585.text: What analyses or data sources could be used to assess concerns regarding the scalability of the underlying [E.N.], and in particular, concerns about the network’s ability to support the growth and adoption of additional smart contracts?

1072952285435756546.text: 8. Does the [E.N.] face scalability challenges? If so, please describe such challenges and any potential solutions...

1072952284781445125.text:
6. How many confirmations on the Ethereum blockchain are sufficient to wait to ensure that the transaction will not end up on an invalid block?
7. How is the technology underlying Ethereum similar to and different from the technology underlying Bitcoin?

1072952284152324096.text: 5. What data sources, analyses, [cals], [vars], or other factors could be used to determine ETH's market size, liquidity, trade volume, types of traders, ownership concentration, and/or principal ways in which the Ethereum Network is currently being used by market participants?

1072952283405672448.text: 4. Are there any existing or developing commercial enterprises that are using Ether to power economic transactions? If so, how is Ether recorded for accounting purposes in a comprehensive set of financial statements?

1072952282625515522.text: 3. How is the developer community currently utilizing the [E.N.]? More specifically, what are prominent use cases or examples that demonstrate the functionalities and capabilities of the [E.N.]?

1072952281845379072.text:
1/ CFTC RFI on ETH https://www.cftc.gov/sites/default/files/2018-12/federalregister121118.pdf …
1. What was the impetus for developing ETH and the Ethereum Network... relative to BTC?
2. What are the current functionalities and capabilities of ETH and the [E.N.] as compared to the functionalities and capabilities of BTC?
